2024-16420,Solutions Product Manager TIDES (Bio)Pharma Market (m/f/d),<div class=""iCIMS_JobContent"">

Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. Bruker’s high performance scientific instruments and high value analytical and diagnostic solutions enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular, and microscopic levels. In close cooperation with our customers, Bruker is enabling innovation, improved productivity, and customer success in life science molecular and cell biology research, in applied and pharma applications, in microscopy and nanoanalysis, as well as in industrial applications. Today, worldwide more than 8500 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 90 locations.

Bruker offers differentiated, high-value life science and diagnostics systems and solutions in preclinical imaging, clinical phenomics research, proteomics and multiomics, spatial and single-cell biology, functional structural and condensate biology, as well as in clinical microbiology and molecular diagnostics.

The solutions product manager (bio)pharma market is responsible to develop solutions for the pharmaceutical market, managing and coordinating the integration of systems, components, services, software, procedures (SOPs, qualification, documentation) and consumables that will proactively aid the drive to market expansion and enhance the value chain, according to the strategy plan. She/he is responsible for all stages of Bruker BioSpin’s product portfolio management for the assigned portfolio. She/he will ensure successful go to market and continuously reduce time-to-money of newly launched solutions.
In this case, the fist assignment will be peptides and oligonucleotides (TIDES). He/she will be responsible of showing the value of NMR to analyze these emerging drug modalities.

Expand adoption of Bruker’s magnetic resonance technology in existing and new (bio)pharma market segments according to Bruker BioSpin’s strategy. Innovative displacement and/or disruptive strategies against competing incumbent technologies are crucial.
Expand deployment capabilities of Bruker’s magnetic resonance technology into non-expert manufacturing and testing environments.
Develop a differentiated and value-rich solution portfolio with a re-current business model.
Pro-actively participate in the (bio)pharma market strategy development and execution process with a strong focus on creating sustained double digit annual growth of business.

Lead product life cycle and product portfolio management processes of assigned portfolio within the (bio)pharma market, including accountability of the stage gating process and corrective measures for product health, maturity, functionality, and business performance and for profitability (COGS/GM, re-current business models) of the full (software and hardware including instruments) solution portfolio as a whole.

Establish, in cooperation with market management, a uniquely differentiated solution offering with an attractive and competitive total cost of ownership compared to competitive analytical methods and to competing companies. Accountable of the execution of the solution portfolio roadmap timely and with quality. Coordinate resources both within and outside the solutions development team when needed with the aim to accomplish the agreed deadlines.
Understand market trends, dynamics and the use cases for these solution offerings and translate into requirements for design for usability, workflow integration, training and maintenance concepts.

Increase the market awareness of Bruker BioSpin’s (bio)pharma market solution portfolios expansion initiatives by content creation activities such as, but not limited to, customer facing presentations and application notes.

Develop uniquely differentiated value propositions for new solutions including smart data handling and interconnectivity to existing data management systems including re-current revenue business models.
Develop and drive an innovative vision for entering new markets including displacement and/or disruptive strategies for competing technologies and establish magnetic resonance as the standard.
Drive the product innovation management, including deployment scouting, new market identification and expansion in cooperation with market management, IP strategy and collaboration management.
Develop and maintain a deep understanding of competitive landscapes also including competing technologies.
Interface with market management and business unit management, divisional application development, technical and platform product management, Central Research and Development (R&amp
column2: D), sales and operations. Recommend new application solutions, developments, or enhancements as a result of customer and/or sales force feedback.

column1: Take accountability for certain financial metrics of the divisional quarterly/annual business performance, such as total gross margin of complete (bio)pharma markets solution portfolios, return on investment of new solutions, product vitality rate and time-to-market.
Effectively increase the adoption rate the solutions throughout and enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty.

Achieve acknowledgment and endorsement of new solutions by associations in cooperation with market management. Ensure appropriate validation and testing of new solutions and methods. Establish, coordinate and support beta-testing.
Work in close partnership with market management to enable successful go to market and launch of new products, solutions and methods.

Timely and efficiently transfer the new solutions to the different departments by generating the necessary material and delivering training to the applications, sales and service organization. Work with the commercial organization and market management to identify market personas along the different pharma market segments. Design sales and marketing campaigns targeted to those personas.

Work with market management, the pharma business partner and group marketing during the go2market stage: launch plan, pricing, option number design and introduction in CRM, generation of marketing material (presentation, guides, videos, webinars, white papers…)
Attend conferences, meetings and pharma events focusing on lead generation, gathering market insights and building long lasting relationship with existing key customers.
Actively contribute to lead generation and nurturing. Embrace, disseminate and help improving the tools the organization provides for this.

All our systems and instruments are designed to improve safety of products, to accelerate time-to-market, and to support industries in successfully enhancing quality of life. We have been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for over 60 years now. Today, more than 8,500 employees distributed across 90 locations around the world continue to delight our customers with innovative solutions.

Bruker Nano, one of Bruker’s four operating segments, provides customers in academic and governmental institutions, life science, materials, and applied industries with the tools to determine the characteristics of matter and visualize the structure of molecules. Divisions within BNANO include Bruker AXS, Bruker Nano Analytics, Bruker Nano Surfaces and Metrology, Fluorescence Microscopy, and Canopy.

All our systems and instruments are designed to improve safety of products, to accelerate time-to-market, and to support industries in successfully enhancing quality of life. Bruker Daltonics Applied Mass Spectrometry division has an opening for an Application Scientist based either in Billerica, MA, or San Jose, CA.

The successful candidate shall champion the Bruker range of Mass Spectrometry products focused on forensic, food, environmental, industrial, and other types of small molecule analysis through expert scientific support of sales activities, demonstrations, collaborative work, and presentations. He or she shall help to create an unrivalled reputation for the company through training and support of existing customers and help to drive product commercialization through technical marketing activities and promotions.

The successful candidate will be an expert in Nominal Mass and High-Resolution Accurate Mass (HRAM) Mass Spectrometry (MS), Liquid and Gas Chromatography (LC/GC), as well as ESI and APCI ionization techniques.  The successful candidate will report to and work closely with the Market Manager.  The position involves travel within the USA and abroad.

Prepare and deliver high quality pre-sales demonstrations of Bruker Mass Spectrometry solutions including both hardware and software with focus on forensic, food, environmental, industrial, and other types of small molecule analysis.
Perform analyses of samples submitted by prospective customers, prepare demo reports, and present results.

Maintain the demo lab instruments at the highest level of performance and in constant readiness by monitoring their critical parameters, performing routine maintenance, and timely requesting service support as necessary.
Provide expert scientific support for sales staff and assistance for customers, including site visits and online communications.
Lead the scientific work with prospective and existing customers to generate interest, build relationships, develop application specific methods and justifications for purchase.
Assist in the post-installation of new MS systems by providing on-site or virtual customer training and application specific method development support.

Develop key applications for Bruker products in the areas of food, environmental, forensic, and other types of small molecule analysis to be used for posters, presentations, and marketing collaterals.

Ensure continual awareness of developments in forensic, food, environmental, and industrial, and other types of small molecule analysis by attending scientific conferences and trade shows, as well as monitoring professional literature and publications.
PhD in Chemistry, Analytical Science or equivalent experience in industry.
A wide understanding and knowledge of forensic, food, environmental, and industrial, and other types of small molecule analysis.
At least 2 years of hands-on experience with Nominal Mass and/or High-Resolution Accurate Mass (HRAM) MS instrumentation.
Considerable expertise with GC and HPLC, as well as ESI and APCI ionization techniques.
Hands-on experience with DART and other ionization techniques is desirable.
Hands-on experience with Ion Mobility Spectrometry (IMS) is desirable.
Working knowledge of Bruker instruments and software is desirable.
Excellent communication and presentation skills for effective work with customers and in-house personnel.
Current valid driving license and passport.
